reviews.text: I had a one night stay at the Swallow Park in Montrose during October 2005. I have stayed in a number of hotels in smaller Scottish towns over the years and therefore did not expect too much. I was to be pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Just a Little Chilly

reviews.text: I was allocated a room in the Coach House which was bright, spacious and well equipped. The room was clean and well maintained but it would have been nice if someone had switched the radiator on before my arrival. The room was cold and never properly warmed up during my short stay.
reviews.title: Basic & Central
good value
reviews.text: Drinks and food were reasonably priced and of good quality. At breakfast the service was a trifle brusque but that is not unusual in that part of the world. The reception staff were particularly helpful and friendly.
